question.text: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle is perhaps [^more famous than | more famous than] any other crime writer in history.
He wrote 60 short stories and four novels about Sherlock Holmes, who is today one of the [^most popular | most popular] detective heroes in crime fiction.

params.instruct_panel_str: If you are unsure about how the animation above works click the "Instructions" button for help

question.text: The first Sherlock Holmes story, A Study in Scarlet, appeared in 1887. It was a great success. Perhaps [the most important | more important than | the more important] reason for the popularity of the story was the character of Sherlock Holmes.
question.modelAnswerString: The first Sherlock Holmes story, A Study in Scarlet, appeared in 1887. It was a great success. Perhaps the most important reason for the popularity of the story was the character of Sherlock Holmes.

question.text: Holmes was [cleverer | the most clever | more clever] than any other detective hero at the time.
question.modelAnswerString: Holmes was cleverer than any other detective hero at the time.

question.text: He was [more mysterious | more mysterious than | mysterious than] , too.

Doyle was a doctor at the time, and although he only received £25 for his story he went on to make the [most difficult | more difficult | more difficult than] decision of his life – to continue writing.
question.modelAnswerString: Doyle was a doctor at the time, and although he only received £25 for his story he went on to make the most difficult decision of his life – to continue writing.

question.text: His next novel, The Sign of Four, was followed by many more, as Doyle decided he wanted to become one of [the biggest | bigger | bigger than] names in English literature.
question.modelAnswerString: His next novel, The Sign of Four, was followed by many more, as Doyle decided he wanted to become one of the biggest names in English literature.

question.text: However, Doyle didn't think his Sherlock Holmes stories were [the most significant | more significant | more significant than] of his works.
question.modelAnswerString: However, Doyle didn't think his Sherlock Holmes stories were the most significant of his works.

question.text: He preferred to write historical novels such as The White Company and The Great Shadow, which were [more serious | the most serious | more serious than] .
question.modelAnswerString: He preferred to write historical novels such as The White Company and The Great Shadow, which were more serious.

question.text: But the public loved Sherlock Holmes and these stories were certainly [more popular than | the most popular | popular than] his other books.
question.modelAnswerString:
But the public loved Sherlock Holmes and these stories were certainly
more popular than his other books.

question.text: In 1893 Doyle tried to 'kill' Sherlock Holmes in The Final Problem. However, Sherlock Holmes was [the most successful | more successful than | more successful] character in fiction at the time and the public wanted more.
question.modelAnswerString:
In 1893 Doyle tried to 'kill' Sherlock Holmes in The Final Problem. However,
Sherlock Holmes was the most successful character in fiction at the time and the public
wanted more.

question.text: Therefore, Holmes returned in his [most exciting | more exciting | exciting] story ever – The Hound of the Baskervilles.
question.modelAnswerString: Therefore, Holmes returned in his most exciting story ever – The Hound of the Baskervilles.
